newsitem.title: FRANCE: French analysts cut profit forecasts again.
newsitem.headline: French analysts cut profit forecasts again.

text.p: The French research body Associes en Finance revised downward on Thursday its latest company profit forecasts for 1996 and 1997.
The average cut in 1996 forecast earnings per share for 150 stocks was 2.3 percent and 1.8 percent for the CAC-40 companies. The cut in 1997 EPS was respectively 1.7 and 1.5 percent.

It said the revisions were mainly on cyclical stocks and did not take into account all the first-half results reported so far. The group, which includes 18 brokerages and research houses, said in August it cut EPS forecasts for 1996 and 1997 respectively by an average 1.8 percent and 0.8 percent.
